p: For detection of CoVs, some innovative approaches have focused on application of QDs. As an example, chiral zirconium QDs were prepared using L(+)-ascorbic acid, which showed fluorescence and circular dichroism characteristics [ 53]. The cytotoxicity of the prepared QDs was evaluated against rat brain glioma C6 cells using 3-(4,5-dimethylthiazol-2-yl)-2,5-diphenyltetrazolium bromide (MTT) assay. The anti-infectious bronchitis virus (IBV) antibodies of CoV were linked to these QDs to produce an immuno-link at the existence of anti-IBV antibody-conjugated magneto-plasmonic NPs and the target analyte. The fluorescence characteristics of the nanohybrids (immuno-conjugated QD-magneto-plasmonic NPs) via the external magnetic field-prompted partition process provided biosensing of CoVs (detection limit being: 79.15 EID/50 Î¼L) ( Figure 9) [ 53].
